pr_title: Restrict loading of external plugins to cloud based recipes

timeline.message:
Restrict loading of external plugins to cloud based recipes

With this change, only recipes which are from cloud are trusted and
loaded as plugins. This aims to create development friction for customers as
they cannot create a local plugin recipe and load it. We want to do this
for 2 reasons. 1. Our plugin interface is not final and is subject to changes
with later greengrass releases. 2. A malicious user cannot modify existing plugin
on the disk or load a new one.

timeline.bodyText: not sure where, but we must deserialize somewhere else, can you dedupe?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: Why check for null, just remove it. A node with a null value is still a node which can be removed.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: use find instead of lookup, then check for null on the returned topic
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: why isn't string comparison enough given that both strings are already b64 encoded?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: yeah. that works. I was trying to use the equals method provided by digest, lets keep this way unless you feel strongly about it.
replies.author: prateek-y

timeline.bodyText: don't call new. Just use context.get(ComponentStore.class)
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText:
instead of using main, let's use the nucleus name

replies.bodyText: I was intentionally trying to create at this point if it does not exist. What do you think the right behavior should be, Since this is part of kernel I was thinking to create runtime topic for main if it doesnt exist.
replies.author: prateek-y

replies.bodyText: Why do you want to create it? Your purpose is it check if it is set or not.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: You should use lookup when you are actually setting the digest, I agree with that
replies.author: MikeDombo
